page.title: 02A HOTEL OWNER'S DAY
page.content: {A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A HOTEL OWNER My Dad owns a hotel on the promenade. Every day he has to get up at seven a.m. to be at the hotel by seven thirty.By this time the kitchen and dining-room staff have arrived, and the chambermaids begin to serve morning tea. My Dad and Jill,the manageress, sort out bills and wages. During the morning they go to the bank,and on Wednesdays my Dad and some chefs go to the stores to buy a week's supply of food which fills a trailer and the boot of a car. During the rest of the day he helps in the kitchen and behind the bar.In the evening there is entertainment.If the hotel is not so busy,my Dad will call the Bingo,but the entertainers generally do this. My Dad's day at the hotel is finished.
